content:
CompositeCollection Class

In this Article

Enables multiple collections and items to be displayed as a single list.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Windows.Localizability(System.Windows.LocalizationCategory.Ignore)]
public class CompositeCollection : System.Collections.IList, System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged, System.ComponentModel.ICollectionViewFactory, System.Windows.IWeakEventListener

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • CompositeCollection

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

CompositeCollection can contain items such as strings, objects, XML nodes, elements, as well as other collections. An ItemsControl uses the data in the CompositeCollection to generate its content according to its ItemTemplate. For more information about using ItemsControl objects to bind to collections, see the Binding to Collections section of the Data Binding Overview.

Constructors summary

CompositeCollection()

Creates a new instance of the CompositeCollection class that is empty and has default initial capacity.
CompositeCollection(Int32)

Creates a new instance of the CompositeCollection class that is empty and has a specified initial capacity.

Properties summary

Count

Gets the number of items stored in this collection.
Item(Int32)

Indexer property that retrieves or replaces the item at the given zero-based offset in the collection.

Methods summary

Add(Object)

Adds the specified item to this collection.
Clear()

Clears the collection.
Contains(Object)

Checks to see if a given item is in this collection.
CopyTo(Array,Int32)

Makes a shallow copy of object references from this collection to the given array.
IndexOf(Object)

Returns the index in this collection where the given item is found.
Insert(Int32,Object)

Inserts an item in the collection at a given index. All items after the given position are moved down by one.
ReceiveWeakEvent(Type,Object,EventArgs)

Handles events from the centralized event table.
Remove(Object)

Removes the given item reference from the collection. All remaining items move up by one.
RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes an item from the collection at the given index. All remaining items move up by one.

Events summary

CollectionChanged

Occurs when the collection changes, either by adding or removing an item.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

ICollection.IsSynchronized

This member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
ICollection.SyncRoot

This member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator.
IList.IsFixedSize

This member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
IList.IsReadOnly

This member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
ICollectionViewFactory.CreateView()

This member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
IWeakEventListener.ReceiveWeakEvent(Type,Object,EventArgs)

This member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

Constructors

  • CompositeCollection()

    Creates a new instance of the CompositeCollection class that is empty and has default initial capacity.

    public CompositeCollection ();
  • CompositeCollection(Int32)

    Creates a new instance of the CompositeCollection class that is empty and has a specified initial capacity.

    public CompositeCollection (int capacity);

    Parameters

    • capacity
      Int32

      The number of items that the new list is initially capable of storing.

Properties

  • Count

    Gets the number of items stored in this collection.

    public int Count { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The number of items stored in this collection.

    Remarks

    A CollectionContainer object counts as 1 item.

  • Item(Int32)

    Indexer property that retrieves or replaces the item at the given zero-based offset in the collection.

    public object this[int itemIndex] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • itemIndex
      Int32

      The zero-based offset of the item to retrieve or replace.

    Property Value

    • System.Object

      The item at the specified zero-based offset.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      If the index is out of range.

Methods

  • Add(Object)

    Adds the specified item to this collection.

    public int Add (object newItem);

    Parameters

    • newItem
      System.Object

      New item to add to the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      Zero-based index where the new item is added.

  • Clear()

    Clears the collection.

    public void Clear ();

    Remarks

    This method resets the collection to be empty.

  • Contains(Object)

    Checks to see if a given item is in this collection.

    public bool Contains (object containItem);

    Parameters

    • containItem
      System.Object

      The item to check.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the collection contains the given item; otherwise, false.

  • CopyTo(Array,Int32)

    Makes a shallow copy of object references from this collection to the given array.

    public void CopyTo (Array array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      Array

      The array that is the destination of the copy operation.

    • index
      Int32

      Zero-based index in the target array at which the copying starts.

  • IndexOf(Object)

    Returns the index in this collection where the given item is found.

    public int IndexOf (object indexItem);

    Parameters

    • indexItem
      System.Object

      The item to retrieve the index for.

    Returns

    • Int32

      If the item appears in the collection, then the zero-based index in the collection where the given item is found; otherwise, -1.

  • Insert(Int32,Object)

    Inserts an item in the collection at a given index. All items after the given position are moved down by one.

    public void Insert (int insertIndex, object insertItem);

    Parameters

    • insertIndex
      Int32

      The index to insert the item at.

    • insertItem
      System.Object

      The item reference to add to the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      If index is out of range.

  • ReceiveWeakEvent(Type,Object,EventArgs)

    Handles events from the centralized event table.

    protected virtual bool ReceiveWeakEvent (Type managerType, object sender, EventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • managerType
      Type

      The type of the WeakEventManager calling this method. This only recognizes manager objects of type CollectionChangedEventManager.

    • sender
      System.Object

      Object that originated the event.

    • e
      EventArgs

      Event data.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the listener handled the event; otherwise, false.

  • Remove(Object)

    Removes the given item reference from the collection. All remaining items move up by one.

    public void Remove (object removeItem);

    Parameters

    • removeItem
      System.Object

      The item to remove.

  • RemoveAt(Int32)

    Removes an item from the collection at the given index. All remaining items move up by one.

    public void RemoveAt (int removeIndex);

    Parameters

    • removeIndex
      Int32

      The index at which to remove an item.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      If index is out of range.

Events

  • CollectionChanged

    Occurs when the collection changes, either by adding or removing an item.

    protected event System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventHandler CollectionChanged;

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • ICollection.IsSynchronized

    This member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

    bool System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized { get; }

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if access to the ICollection is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, false.

  • ICollection.SyncRoot

    This member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

    object System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot { get; }

    Returns

    • System.Object

      An object that can be used to synchronize access to the ICollection.

  • IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

    Returns an enumerator.

    System.Collections.IEnumerator IEnumerable.GetEnumerator ();

    Returns

    • IEnumerator

      An IEnumerator object.

  • IList.IsFixedSize

    This member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

    bool System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize { get; }

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the IList has a fixed size; otherwise, false.

  • IList.IsReadOnly

    This member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

    bool System.Collections.IList.IsReadOnly { get; }

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the IList is read-only; otherwise, false.

  • ICollectionViewFactory.CreateView()

    This member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

    System.ComponentModel.ICollectionView ICollectionViewFactory.CreateView ();

    Returns

    • ICollectionView

      The view created.

  • IWeakEventListener.ReceiveWeakEvent(Type,Object,EventArgs)

    This member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

    bool IWeakEventListener.ReceiveWeakEvent (Type managerType, object sender, EventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • managerType
      Type

      The type of the WeakEventManager calling this method. This only recognizes manager objects of type CollectionChangedEventManager.

    • sender
      System.Object

      Object that originated the event.

    • e
      EventArgs

      Event data.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the listener handled the event; otherwise, false.
